langman_header: Translate the word "English"; do not change it to your own language!
langman_adding:
Used to indicate the system is adding the language. Parameters:
* $1 - the language name
* $2 - the language's ISO 639-3 code
langman_field_optional:
Here, '''optional''' refers to the fields labeled with text from {{msg-mw|Langman iso639-2}} and {{msg-mw|Langman wikimedia}}.
{{Identical|Optional}}
langman_addlang: Button text when adding a new language in the Language Manager.
datasearch_showing_only:
Parameters:
* $1 - 100 (hard-coded)
* $2 - number of results (number of matches), or empty string(?)
ow_importtsv_header: 'test run' comes from {{msg-mw|ow importtsv test run}}.
ow_importtsv_bad_columns:
Unused (commented out) at this time.

Do not translate 'definition_iso' and 'translations_iso'.

Parameters:
* $1 - column name
ow_importtsv_results:
Commented out because the code is outdated.

This message indicates that definitions and translations have been added.

Parameters:
* $1 - number of definitions which have been added
* $2 - number of translations which have been added
ow_impexptsv_unknown_lang:
Parameters:
* $1 - language code
The page title for this message is {{msg-mw|Ow exporttsv export failed}}.
ow_exporttsv_export_failed:
Used as page title.

The page body for this message is {{msg-mw|Ow impexptsv unknown lang}}.
ow_noedit_title:
Used as page title.

The page body for this message is {{msg-mw|Ow noedit}}.
ow_noedit:
Used as page body.

Uses the message {{msg-mw|Ow editing policy url}}.

The title for this message is {{msg-mw|Ow noedit title}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - dataset name
ow_editing_policy_url:
{{notranslate}}
Used as link target in {{msg-mw|Ow noedit}}
transaction: A 'transaction' is a database transaction: a set of database operations considered as a whole.
ow_conceptmapping_uitext: A "dataset" is an independant collection of data, such as an ontology, a thesaurus, or a specific dictionary.
ow_conceptmapping_no_action_specified:
Parameters:
* $1 - unsupported action. It can be anything that has been provided by a client.
Supported actions are: insert, get, help, get_associated
ow_AddHint: Hint that shows up when the mouse hovers the plus sign in table rows (such as Synonyms and Translations) while editing
ow_AnnotationDefinedMeaning: The title of a section containing annotations relating to the meaning/semantics of a word (image, hypernyms, etc.)
ow_AnnotationSyntrans: The title of a section containing annotations that are lexical (pronunciation, etymology, etc.)
ow_DefinedMeaning:
A selection (action link) on the page Special:Ow_statistics

{{Identical|Defined meaning}}
ow_Multiple_meanings:
Used as page title. Parameters:
* $1 - page title
ow_RelatedTo: The header of a column where the user enters the second member of a relation
ow_Relations:
Title of a section containing a list of relations between different words or concepts (e.g. hypernym, antonym).
{{Identical|Relation}}
ow_RelationType: The header of a column where the user selects a relation from a list of relations (e.g. hypernym, antonym)
ow_Remove:
Header caption for the selection boxes used to remove a row from a table (such as in Synonyms and Translations)
{{Identical|Remove}}
ow_RemoveHint: Hint that shows up when the mouse hovers the Remove column header while editing
ow_SuggestHint: Hint that shows up when the mouse hovers a choice box containing items such as languages, annotation types, etc.
ow_meaningsoftitle:
Unused at this time.

Used as page title. Parameters:
* $1 - page title
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Ow meaningsofsubtitle}}
ow_meaningsofsubtitle:
Unused at this time.

Used as page subtitle. Parameters:
* $1 - page title
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Ow meaningsoftitle}}
ow_Permission_denied:
Visible on [http://www.omegawiki.org/Special:Copy this OmegaWiki page] (make sure you're not logged in)
{{Identical|Permission denied}}
ow_needs_xlation_source_lang:
Visible on this [http://www.omegawiki.org/Special:NeedsTranslation OmegaWiki page].
{{Identical|Source language}}
ow_upload:
Text in the upload button after selecting a TSV file for import.
{{Identical|Upload}}
ow_collection_added:
This message indicates that the collection $1 has been added.

Parameters:
* $1 - collection name
ow_nstab_definedmeaning:
Tab title when displaying a Defined Meaning.
{{Identical|Defined meaning}}
ow_nstab_edit_copy: Tab title when copying across datasets. The word 'edit' is a verb here.
ow_shown_datasets: A "dataset" is an independant collection of data, such as an ontology, a thesaurus, or a specific dictionary.
prefs-ow-lang:
A header in the user preferences where the user can configure languages.
{{Identical|Language}}
ow_pref_lang_switch: A checkbox in the user preferences. If checked, it allows the user to select which languages should be displayed. If unchecked, all languages are displayed.
ow_pref_lang_select: Next to this text is shown a list of languages, each with a checkbox, to select the languages to display or hide in OmegaWiki
ow_addFromExtAPI: Special page name for adding OmegaWiki data from External APIs
ow_addFromExtAPI_title: The page title for Special page name for adding OmegaWiki data from External APIs
ow-special-stat-head: Used in Special:Statistics as an additional section header.
ow-special-stat-languages-avail:
Used in Special:Statistics as a label for the number of languages that can be used to add lexical data to.
* $1 - The number of languages for PLURAL use. Use only if needed in the tabular context. (optional)
ow-special-stat-languages-used:
Used in Special:Statistics as a label for the number of languages for which lexical data actually exists.
* $1 - The number of languages for PLURAL use. Use only if needed in the tabular context. (optional)
ow-special-stat-syntranses:
Used in Special:Statistics as a label for the number of synonymes and/or translations in the lexical data.
* $1 - The number of synonymes and/or translations for PLURAL use. Use only if needed in the tabular context. (optional)
ow-special-stat-expressions:
Used in Special:Statistics as a label for the number of expressions contained inthe lexical data.
* $1 - The number of expressions for PLURAL use. Use only if needed in the tabular context. (optional)
ow-special-stat-meanings:
Used in Special:Statistics as a label for the number of definitons in the lexical data.
* $1 - The number of definitons for PLURAL use. Use only if needed in the tabular context. (optional)
ow-special-stat-definedmeanings:
Used in Special:Statistics as a label for the number of definedMeanings present in the  lexical data.
* $1 - The number of definedMeanings for PLURAL use. Use only if needed in the tabular context. (optional)
ow-special-stat-collections:
Used in Special:Statistics as a label for the number of collecions existing in the  lexical data.
* $1 - The number of collecions for PLURAL use. Use only if needed in the tabular context. (optional)
ow-special-stat-classes:
Used in Special:Statistics as a label for the number of classes in the lexical data.
* $1 - The number of classes for PLURAL use. Use only if needed in the tabular context. (optional)
ow-stat-header: Header of the Statistics page of Lexical Data
ow-stat-overview-link: Action link anchor in the Statistics page of Lexical Data
ow-stat-annotations-link: Action link anchor in the Statistics page of Lexical Data
ow-stat-syntranses-link: Action link anchor in the Statistics page of Lexical Data
ow-stat-syntranses:
Table head and label used in the Statistics page of Lexical Data.
* $1 - The number of syntrans' for PLURAL use. Not to be dispayed here, since the figure is shown elsewhere.
ow-stat-expressions-link: Action link anchor in the Statistics page of Lexical Data
ow-stat-expressions:
Table head and label used in the Statistics page of Lexical Data.
* $1 - The number of expressions for PLURAL use. Not to be dispayed here, since the figure is shown elsewhere.
ow-stat-meanings-link: Action link anchor in the Statistics page of Lexical Data
ow-stat-meanings:
Table head and label used in the Statistics page of Lexical Data.
* $1 - The number of meanings/definitins for PLURAL use. Not to be dispayed.
ow-stat-definedmeanings-link: Action link anchor in the Statistics page of Lexical Data
ow-stat-definedmeanings:
Table head and label used in the Statistics page of Lexical Data.
* $1 - The number of defined meanings for PLURAL use. Not to be dispayed here, since the figure is shown elsewhere.
ow-stat-languages:
Table head and label used in the Statistics page of Lexical Data.
* $1 - The number of languages in use for PLURAL use. Not to be dispayed here, since the figure is shown elsewhere.
ow-stat-class-annotations: * $1 - The number of class annotations for PLURAL use. Not to be dispayed here, since the figure is shown elsewhere.
ow-stat-url-annotations: * $1 - The number of URL annotations for PLURAL use. Not to be dispayed here, since the figure is shown elsewhere.
ow-stat-text-annotations: * $1 - The number of text annotations for PLURAL use. Not to be dispayed here, since the figure is shown elsewhere.
ow-stat-option-annotations: * $1 - The number of option annotations for PLURAL use. Not to be dispayed here, since the figure is shown elsewhere.
ow-stat-all-is:
Shown after the 100% bar in headers of the statistics pages of Lexical Data having bar diagrams. This is used to tell thet this bar symbolizes 100% and that this is all of the underlying data. Keep this very short. If you cannot do so, leave the 'all =' part out, and let it be only $1.
Prameter:
* $1 - the localized version of 100% foratted using {{msg-mw|ow-stat-percent}}.
ow-stat-percent:
Shown after the bars in the statistics pages of Lexical Data having bar diagrams. Keep this very short.
Parameter:
* - $1 an integer in the range from 0 to 100 inclusive.

This message is also used to insert the localized ersion of 1100% in {{msg-mw|ow-stat-all-is}}.
